question:
For questions number 18 to 20, Complete the following text with the suitable words.    Mr.Komar is an English teacher. He speak English fluently.
His wife, Mrs. Nani is a(18)......She helps sick people.
She doesn't speak English. Mr.Komar has two children.
They study English not only at school but also at home.
They are(19).....students. Their father teaches them every night,
So they can speak English (20) ......He is very proud of them.
18. a. teacher
b. janitor
c. doctor
d. chef
19. a. lazy
b. proud
c. stupid
d. diligent
20. a. fluently
b. silently
C. slowly
d. badly
This text is for questions number 21 to 23.
My favorite animal is rabbit. Rabit has two longears.
Its eyes are big and black, but when it is dark its eyes are red.
It has two long teeth Its nose is small and soft pink.
Its tail is soft,round and small like a cotton ball. Its legs are small,
It doesn't walk, it jumps It is vegetarian and its favorite food is carrct.
Rabbits are very cute.
21. How many ears does the rabbit have?
a. two ears
c. three ears
b. four ears
d. five ears​

answers.answer:
18. C. Doctor

Penjelasan :

Teks diatas menjelaskan pekerjaan Mrs. Nani yang membantu orang sakit. Jadi, jawabannya adalah (C.)

19. D. Diligent

Penjelasan :

Teks diatas mengatakan mereka selalu belajar Bahasa Inggris setiap malam dan mereka sangat rajin, Jadi jawabannya adalah (D.)

20. A. Fluently

Penjelasan :

Teks diatas mengatakan bahwa Mr. Komar sangat bangga dengan anak-anak nya karena bisa berbahasa Inggris dengan lancar. Jadi jawabannya adalah (A.)

21. How many ears does the rabbit have?

: A. Two ears

Penjelasan :

Berdasarkan teks diatas, kelinci adalah binatang favorit sang penulis dan kelinci itu mempunyai 2 telinga. Jadi jawabannya adalah (A.)

Maaf kalau ada yang salah dalam penyampaian kata²nya, apabila ada yang salah dalam jawabannya bisa dikoreksi yaa, semoga membantu ! <3

—Miranthi P.

related_questions.question:
Quiz ;)    Most fish use their side, back, and tail fins for swimming. Fins (1) … movable, fanlike parts. A fish (2) … through the water by swinging its tail fins back and forth. A fish uses (3) … other fins to steer (4) … to stop. Sometimes the other fins also help it go fast through the water.
 Most fishes have bodies shaped like a torpedo. Their bodies are pointed at the head and at the tail. This streamlined body helps fish speed through water. Sailfish can swim as (5) … as 70 miles per hour (110 kilometers per hour).
(6) … fish have unusual shapes. Rays have flat, disc-shaped bodies. Large fins like wings go out from a ray’s head. To swim, rays flap the fins.
 Most fish also have swim bladders. They fill their swim bladders (7) … air. Their air-filled swim bladders act like life jackets. They keep the fish from sinking to the bottom.

Perintah : Lengkapi kalimat Rumpang menjadi kalimat efektif.​

answers.answer:
Jawaban:

Most fish use their side, back, and tail fins for swimming. Fins (1) are movable, fanlike parts. A fish (2)swims through the water by swinging its tail fins back and forth. A fish uses (3) its other fins to steer (4) its body to stop. Sometimes the other fins also help it go fast through the water.

Most fishes have bodies shaped like a torpedo. Their bodies are pointed at the head and at the tail. This streamlined body helps fish speed through water. Sailfish can swim as (5)fast as 70 miles per hour (110 kilometers per hour).

(6)many fish have unusual shapes. Rays have flat, disc-shaped bodies. Large fins like wings go out from a ray’s head. To swim, rays flap the fins.

Most fish also have swim bladders. They fill their swim bladders (7) contain air. Their air-filled swim bladders act like life jackets. They keep the fish from sinking to the bottom.

  • Lebih simpelnya jawabannya!!!
  • 1.are
  • 2.swims
  • 3.its
  • 4.its body
  • 5.fast
  • 6.many
  • 7.contain

*

related_questions.question:
What is the climax of the strory?    True Friends

 Once upon a time, there were two close friends who were walking through the forest together. They knew that anything dangerous can happen any time in the forest. So they promised each other that they would always be together in any case of danger.

 Suddenly, they saw a large bear getting closer toward them. One of them climbed a nearby tree at once. But unfortunately the other one did not know how to climb up the tree. So being led by his common sense, he lay down on the ground breathless and pretended to be a dead man.

 The bear came near the one who was lying on the ground. It smelt in his ears, and slowly left the place because the bears do not want to touch the dead creatures. After that, the friend on the tree came down and asked his friend that was on the ground, "Friend, what did the bear whisper into your ears?" The other friend replied, "Just now the bear advised me not to believe a false friend."

 Moral of the Story- A true friend in need is a friend indeed

answers.answer:
Jawaban:

Apa klimaks dari cerita tersebut?

Teman sejati

Alkisah, ada dua orang sahabat yang sedang berjalan bersama di hutan. Mereka tahu bahwa segala sesuatu yang berbahaya dapat terjadi kapan saja di hutan. Jadi mereka berjanji satu sama lain bahwa mereka akan selalu bersama dalam keadaan bahaya apa pun.

Tiba-tiba, mereka melihat seekor beruang besar mendekat ke arah mereka. Salah satu dari mereka memanjat pohon terdekat sekaligus. Namun sayangnya yang satunya tidak tahu bagaimana cara memanjat pohon tersebut. Jadi dibimbing oleh akal sehatnya, dia berbaring di tanah dengan terengah-engah dan berpura-pura menjadi orang mati.

Beruang itu mendekati orang yang terbaring di tanah. Itu tercium di telinganya, dan perlahan meninggalkan tempat itu karena beruang tidak mau menyentuh makhluk mati. Setelah itu, teman di pohon itu turun dan bertanya kepada temannya yang ada di tanah, "Teman, apa yang dibisikkan beruang ke telingamu?" Teman yang lain menjawab, "Baru saja beruang itu menasihati saya untuk tidak mempercayai teman palsu."

Moral of the Story- Teman sejati yang membutuhkan adalah teman sejati.

Semoga membantu^^
